mods.note: 30 th May, 1946 The Post Master, General Post Office, Karachi, India. Bahrain Receipt Dear Sirs We refer you to our letter of 6th May wherein was mentioned the difficulty that this Company was experiencing in obtaining adequate monthly supplies of postage stamps in the higher denominations from the local Post Office. We believe that a postal franking machine, such as our associates, Caltex (India) Limited, are using, might solve the problem since our stamp requirements would be re duced to a small monthly order for the lower denominations to use on our employees 1 mail. We also believe that such a machine should enable us to handle our mail more expeditiously, than in the past. It would be necessary that the machine be equipped for the higher denomination stamps, say up to Rs. 10, 15, 25 because of the weight of our individual postal packages. We understand that these machines are loaned out on a hire basis. Will you please advise as soon as possible whether a machine could be made available for our use and on what terms. Yours very truly, THL BAHREIN PETROLEUM COMPANY LIMITED R. M. physicalDescription.extent: The papers in the file are arranged chronologically. There are notes at the end of the file, on folio 13. The notes are arranged chronologically and refer to documents within the file; they give brief description of the correspondence with a number in blue and red crayon, which refers back to that correspondence in the file.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 9; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is also present in parallel between ff 3-6; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled, and are located in the same position as the main sequence.

mods.abstract: The file contains a letter from Bahrain Petroleum Company Limited (BAPCO) requesting to purchase a franking machine to cater for their needs for stamps. The request is granted by the Political Agent at Bahrain.
